content.text: > **Note**: The provisions in this appendix are *not mandatory* unless specifically referenced in the adopting ordinance.

content.bullet: Notches on the ends of joists shall not exceed one-fourth the joist depth.
Holes bored in joists shall not be within 2 inches (51 mm) of the top or bottom of the joist.
Diameter of any such hole shall not exceed one-third the depth of the joist.
Notches in the top or bottom of joists shall not exceed one-sixth the depth.
Notches shall not be located in the middle third of the span.
In exterior walls and bearing partitions, a wood stud may be cut/notched up to 25% of its width.
In nonbearing partitions, studs may be cut/notched up to 40% of their width.

content.text: - Max diameter = 40% of depth in general.
- Max diameter = 60% of depth in nonbearing partitions.
- Max diameter = 60% in any wall where each stud is doubled (no more than two successive doubles).
- Not closer than 5/8 inch (15.9 mm) to the edge of the stud.
- Not located at the same section of the stud as a cut or notch.

content.bullet: Cutting, notching, and boring of holes in structural steel framing must follow prescriptions of a registered design professional.
No cutting/notching of flanges or lips in load-bearing members.

content.text: - Must be centered along the web’s centerline.
- Subject to spacing, dimension, and edge distance limits defined by a registered design professional.

content.bullet: Steel floor/roof decking must follow professional specifications.

content.heading: [BS] C101.6 Nonstructural Cold-Formed Steel Wall Framing

content.bullet: No cutting/notching of flanges or lips.
